conclusion: Analyze the motion of the missile in two phases: Phase 1 - vertical motion, Phase 2 - curvilinear motion.
Phase 1: The missile accelerates vertically upward from rest with an acceleration of 10g until it reaches an altitude of 5000 m.
Phase 2: The missile follows a curved trajectory after the direction of gas expulsion changes to an angle θ such that cosθ = 1/11.
Calculate the time taken to reach 5000 m using the kinematic equation h = 1/2 a t^2.
The time taken to reach 5000 m is t = 10 s.
Calculate the velocity at 5000 m using the kinematic equation v = a t.
The velocity at 5000 m is v = 1000 m/s.
At 5000 m, the direction of gas expulsion changes, and the missile begins curvilinear motion.
The thrust force F now acts at an angle θ such that cosθ = 1/11.
Calculate the thrust force using Newton's second law F = m a.
The thrust force is F = 10000 N.
Calculate the horizontal and vertical components of acceleration using a_x = a sinθ and a_y = a cosθ.
Calculate sinθ using the Pythagorean identity sinθ = sqrt(1 - cos^2θ).
